wikipedia_page.main: Mark Sanger (born 13 January 1974) is an Academy Award-winning British film editor.

response: In 2010, Cuarón began to develop the film Gravity, a drama set in space. He was joined by producer David Heyman, with whom Cuarón worked on Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban. Starring Sandra Bullock and George Clooney, the film opened the 70th Venice International Film Festival in August. The film was then released in America in October 2013 The film became financial success earning 723.2 million of the box office against a budget of 130 million. The film also received many awards nominations. For the film, he received the Golden Globe Award in the category of Best Director. The film received ten Academy Award nominations, including Best Picture and Best Director. Cuarón won for Best Directing, becoming the first Latin American to win the award, while he and Mark Sanger received the award for Best Film Editing.

response: **Mark Sanger, British film editor; in London, England
*Mark Sanger, film editor, winner of 2014 Academy Award for editing
